intro: Agrostophyllum crassicaule var. crassicaule, commonly known as the thick-stemmed agrostophyllum, is a member of the Restionaceae family, native to South Africa. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its dense, woody stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in spike-like clusters. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to coastal and Mediterranean climates. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is often found in fynbos vegetation.
